Context:
Program Name: Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality)
Code: H311
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 4 years (8 semesters plus 2 co-op terms)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition: $9,118.00 * † ‡
International Tuition: $21,138.00 ** † ‡
Centre: Hospitality & Culinary Arts
School: Hospitality & Tourism Management
Location: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Co-op (Paid)
Program Overview: Eligible for a $1,000 entrance scholarship. Prepares students for managerial, supervisory and administrative positions in the hospitality industry by teaching technical skills related to operational processes, finance, human resources, marketing, facilities, risk management, corporate social responsibility and sustainability.

Related Programs: Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management (H133), Event Planning (H141)

Context:
The George Brown College Hospitality degree program offers students training in analysis and problem-solving, critical thinking, integrated operations, customer management, and international applications. Students develop strong management and leadership abilities through individual and group projects, with real-world work experience from two co-op terms. Flexible learning is provided, including courses offered in a hybrid format throughout the program and semesters seven and eight delivered entirely online.

Work experience opportunities are identified through employer and industry partnerships, and students are encouraged to pursue self-directed industry work experience. Co-operative education is a significant component of the degree program, with students spending at least two four-month paid terms working full-time in the industry. Graduates can pursue careers across various sectors of the hospitality industry, such as travel, accommodations, food service, sports and recreation, assembly and event management, and many more. The college also offers a student exchange program with Manchester Metropolitan University in Manchester, England.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) Program H311 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text describes a student exchange program with Manchester Metropolitan University in England for students in their second year of study. Graduates of the Hospitality degree program have the option to pursue advanced degrees at partner universities, including IMI and Manchester University, as well as institutions such as the University of Guelph, Toronto Metropolitan University, University of Waterloo, Royal Roads University, and Queen's University.

The text also mentions articulation options for students with a two-year hospitality diploma to upgrade to an Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) degree program. To qualify, students must have a minimum 2.7 GPA or higher. A special semester is offered from May to August to help students fast-track into the program.

The Hospitality diploma program includes required courses in Year 1 and Year 2. In Year 1, semester 1, students take courses such as Introduction to Business Management (HOST 1195), Organizational Behaviour (HOST 1196), Skills for Success (HOST 1197), Financial Accounting (ACCT 1201), Business Communication (COMM 1201), Smart Serve (online certificate), Sanitation (online certificate), and Emergency First Aid/Heartsaver CPR (weekend course). In Year 1, semester 2, students take courses such as Introduction to the Global Hospitality Industry (HOST 1204), Managerial Accounting (ACCT 1202), Human Resources Management (HRM 1201), Marketing Management (MARK 1201), and a Liberal Studies Elective. In Year 2, semester 3, students take courses such as Macroeconomics: Canada in Global Environment (BBUS 1007), Tourism in a Global Community (HOST 2108), Food and Beverage Management (HOST 2109), and Accommodation Management (HOST 1302). Students also take a Liberal Studies Elective in semester 4.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) Program H311 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Liberal Studies program at the college offers courses with a focus on critical analysis, problem-solving, communication, and exploration of personal and societal importance topics. The graduate is expected to demonstrate various skills and abilities, such as assessing environmental impacts on the hospitality industry, explaining research results, applying management knowledge, justifying ideas, interpreting data, presenting information clearly, displaying ethical behavior, designing marketing strategies, and keeping current in the field.

Domestic tuition for programs starting in Fall 2023 is $9,118, while international tuition is $21,138. Additional costs include estimated fees for the first two semesters totaling $575 (subject to change) and co-op work term fees (not included). Financial assistance is available through OSAP for eligible applicants. Tuition fees are subject to board approval and may be changed without notice.

Programs starting in Fall 2024 have estimated tuition, materials, student service, and ancillary fees of $9,118 (domestic) and $21,138 (international). International students should visit the college's International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.

The program does not include the cost of textbooks, which must be purchased separately by the student. Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) Program H311 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: This program may be eligible for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria. Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma with six grade 12 university (U) or university/college (M) courses or equivalent, including a grade 12 (U) English and Mathematics with a minimum grade of 60% in both subjects and an overall average of 65% in six grade 12 (U) or (M) courses. Mature students need to meet the same requirements, but may also consider taking post-secondary courses in English and Mathematics as recommended. English language proficiency is necessary for success in the program, with various tests accepted such as George Brown College ESL Level 9, TOEFL 84 overall and 21 in each skill band (online), IELTS 6.5 overall and 6.0 in each skill band, MELAB 85, or CAEL overall 70 (writing 60). There are course exemptions available based on college or university credits, and international students should refer to the International Admissions page for specific requirements. Applicants with a two-year hospitality diploma are not specified as having a minimum requirement in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) Program H311 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text contains information related to special requirements for applicants with a two-year hospitality diploma, health policy in practical labs, application process for domestic and international students, and contact information for various college offices. Here is the extracted information:

1. Special Requirements: Applicants with a two-year hospitality diploma are encouraged to consider the Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) bridging program if they have an overall GPA of 2.7 in their diploma program and a 3.0 GPA in specific transferable courses.
2. Health Policy: Allergens such as nuts, dairy, and shellfish are used in practical labs, and the college is sensitive to religious observances but may not meet specific dietary laws related to halal and kosher foods.
3. Application Process: Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
4. Contact Information: For inquiries about domestic admission requirements, applicants can contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions web page. For financial and fees inquiries, they can contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid web page. General School of Hospitality and Tourism Management inquiries should be directed to chcastudentsupport@georgebrown.ca.
5. Duration of Consent: George Brown College has been granted a consent by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities to offer the Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) program for a seven-year term starting December 19, 2019.
6. Contact Us: Applicants can contact the college through various means, including email or phone. The Contact Centre number is 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559).
